definitions.definition: To converse together with sympathy and confidence; to interchange sentiments or feelings; to take counsel.
To communicate (with) spiritually; to be together (with); to contemplate or absorb .
examples: He spent a week in the backcountry, communing with nature.

main_definition: To converse together with sympathy and confidence; to interchange sentiments or feelings; to take counsel.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , followed by with ) To communicate (with) spiritually; to be together (with); to contemplate or absorb .
( Christianity , intransitive ) To receive the communion .
